source.54083d7b:
#Let's visualise the evolution of results
evolution = df.groupby('Date').sum()[['CN_Diag_WOM','CN_Diag_CSSE','CN_Diag_WHO']]
#evolution['Expiration Rate'] = (evolution['Expired'] / evolution['Cumulative']) * 100
#evolution['Discharging Rate'] = (evolution['Discharged'] / evolution['Cumulative']) * 100
evolution.head()
source.b3a5f1a3:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,7))
plt.plot(evolution['CN_Diag_WOM'], label='CN_Diag_WOM')
plt.plot(evolution['CN_Diag_CSSE'], label='CN_Diag_CSSE')
plt.plot(evolution['CN_Diag_WHO'], label='CN_Diag_WHO')
plt.legend()
#plt.grid()
plt.title('Evolution of COVID-19 China')
plt.xticks(evolution.index,rotation=45)
plt.xlabel('Date')
plt.ylabel('Number of Diagnosis')
plt.show()
source.3c58a943:
#What about the evolution of China Diagnosed Worldometer rate ?
plt.figure(figsize=(20,7))
plt.plot(evolution['CN_Diag_WOM'], label='China Diagnosed Worldometer Rate')
plt.legend()
#plt.grid()
plt.title('Evolution of COVID-19 China Diagnosed Worldometer Rate')
plt.xticks(evolution.index,rotation=45)
plt.ylabel('Rate %')
plt.show()
source.4cf503e4:
#This is another way of visualizing the evolution: plotting the increase evolution (difference from day to day)
diff_evolution = evolution.diff().iloc[1:]
plt.figure(figsize=(20,7))
plt.plot(diff_evolution['CN_Diag_WOM'], label='China Diagnosed Worldometer Evolution')
plt.legend()
plt.grid()
plt.title('Evolution of China COVID-19 ')
plt.xticks(evolution.index,rotation=45)
plt.ylabel('Rate %')
plt.show()

source.37cd333d:
Columns:

CN_Diag_WOM Chinese daily diagnosed cases (Jan 23 - Mar 15) provided by worldometers.info

CN_Diag_CSSE Chinese daily diagnosed cases (Jan 23 - Mar 15) provided by Johns Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering (JHU CSSE)

CN_Onset_WHO Chinese daily onset symptom cases (Jan 1 - Feb 21) estimated from the plot appearing in the WHO article

CN_Diag_WHO Chinese daily diagnosed cases (Jan 21 - Feb 21) estimated from the plot appearing in the WHO article

IT_Diag Italian daily diagnosed cases (Jan 31 - Mar 15)

source.8741582e: In the case of China under Covid-19, one of them would be the lack of assistance to chronic patients with other diseases who have been left unattended during the isolation imposed by the government. - It would be interesting to know how many people died as a result of authoritarian measures such as city closures. https://oglobo.globo.com/mundo/china-sai-da-defensiva-reivindica-lideranca-global-contra-coronavirus-24309202
source.3bf70e03: One of the biggest concerns is the resumption of economic activity, which has plummeted since the beginning of the crisis: in the first two months of the year, industrial production had the biggest contraction ever recorded, 13.5%.
source.2540754a:
Evaluation of the potential incidence of COVID-19 and effectiveness of contention measures in Spain: a data-driven approach

Abstract

Our society is currently experiencing an unprecedented challenge, managing and containing an outbreak of a new coronavirus disease known as COVID-19. While China -where the outbreak started -seems to have been able to contain the growth of the epidemic, different outbreaks are nowadays being detected in multiple countries. Much is currently unknown about the natural history of the disease, such as a possible asymptomatic spreading or the role of age in both the susceptibility and mortality of the disease. Nonetheless, authorities have to take action and implement contention measures, even if not everything is known. To facilitate this task, we have studied the effect of different containment strategies that can be put into effect. Our work specifically refers to the situation in Spain as of February 28th, 2020, where a few dozens of cases have been detected. We implemented an SEIR-metapopulation model that allows tracing explicitly the spatial spread of the disease through data-driven stochastic simulations. Our results are in line with the most recent recommendations from the World Health Organization, namely, that the best strategy is the early detection and isolation of individuals with symptoms, followed by interventions and public recommendations aimed at reducing the transmissibility of the disease, which although not efficacious for disease eradication, would produce as a second order effect a delay of several days in the raise of the number of infected cases.
source.b438bbac: 84% of the total 80,924 confirmed cases of coronavirus in China are confined to Hubei. Around 96% are also from Hubei. In recent days, China has seen the number of the new daily cases stabilise, while there have been an increasing number of new cases in many other countries and regions around the World. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/which-countries-are-fighting-covid-19-better-than-others/articleshow/74593784.cms
source.f8a010b8:
After two and a half months of the epidemic of the new coronavirus , only a select group of countries is able to reverse or prevent the exponential growth of cases. Almost all of the good examples are in Asia , and have implemented strategies that Brazil has not yet adopted - mainly massive case testing and draconian measures of social isolation.
 Successful cases in preventing a sudden increase in the number of infected people are more isolated urban centers, such as Singapore or Hong Kong , but even entire countries that have lost control of the epidemic , such as South Korea and China itself, have already managed to reverse the explosive trend that had been developing in the epidemic.
More worrying examples of what could happen are in Italy and Iran , where the ability to accommodate critically ill patients has not accounted for the epidemic, but Spain and Germany are also seeing a worrying trend now.
China, where the pathogen emerged, in a few weeks isolated the province of Hubei , the epicenter of the outbreak, restricting the movement of more than 40 million people. The government resorted to more radical measures when Covid-19 expanded, such as controlling population movement through software installed on smartphones, which measures an individual's temperature and determines whether he should be quarantined. https://oglobo.globo.com/sociedade/coronavirus/estrategia-do-brasil-contra-coronavirus-falhou-na-europa-24307007
source.e5473eaa: What is striking in the current crisis is the speed with which China finds itself in a position to emerge from the defensive as a world pariah to claim leadership in fighting the virus. A plane with Chinese medical supplies and healthcare professionals was sent to Italy, and Chinese billionaire Jack Ma, owner of e-commerce site Alibaba, donated 500,000 test kits and a million masks to the United States, while Xi Jinping calls on world leaders to coordinate efforts.
source.e287b40b: With the epicenter of the epidemic moving to Europe, the pressure has shifted to democratic countries, with criticisms of the reluctance to take adequate measures and a reinterpretation of the limits of state interference in private life. Mass individual monitoring measures, which in normal times would be considered a violation of privacy, have been adopted in democracies such as Israel and Taiwan. “War on the virus”, Xi's slogan, came to be heard in other countries, although in Asia democracies like South Korea have succeeded in curbing the epidemic without resorting to draconian measures. https://oglobo.globo.com/mundo/china-sai-da-defensiva-reivindica-lideranca-global-contra-coronavirus-24309202
source.9a6e0ec8:
China comes out of defense and claims global leadership against coronavirus

After a mass mobilization that included the largest quarantine in history, the country seeks to use control of the epidemic as a soft power weapon

While the world is taking unprecedented steps to slow the spread of the coronavirus, the feeling in China is that the worst is over. After a mass mobilization led by the Communist Party, which included the largest quarantine in history, the country where the first cases of Covid-19 emerged announced last week the end of the peak of infections. At about the same time, the World Health Organization (WHO) decreed that the outbreak had become a pandemic.

The change in focus gave fuel to the triumphalistic tone that was already outlined in the Chinese media, controlled by the regime. From a defensive stance at the beginning of the crisis, when the Chinese government was accused of worsening the situation by hiding the problem, trying to clean up the country's image and promote its authoritarian management model as the most efficient to face emergencies.

The epidemic that erupted in Wuhan city at the turn of the year has become the biggest challenge facing the Chinese CP since the Tiananmen Square student protests in 1989, but the official speech tells another story, in which President Xi Jinping is the “commander of the people's war” in the victory against the virus. The narrative that China turned the game started to be used to stimulate the nationalist spirit inside the country and, abroad, to reflect the image of global power capable of giving lessons to the world.
https://oglobo.globo.com/mundo/china-sai-da-defensiva-reivindica-lideranca-global-contra-coronavirus-24309202
source.e690a7e2: The Alibaba co-founder committed to sending 1 million medical masks and 500,000 coronavirus testing kits to the U.S. on Chinese social site Weibo on Friday. It’s being done through the Jack Ma Foundation. In case you only speak English, a translated version of the announcement was posted to Twitter at the same time. https://www.realtalktime.com/jack-ma-ali-baba-co-founder-face-masks-test-kits-covid-19/
